data.event: A 2013 estimate places the population at 499,137.

event.title: was created by an act of the Congress of the Republic of Texas on December 14, 1837

data.event: The county was created by an act of the Congress of the Republic of Texas on December 14, 1837 and is named for the town of Montgomery.

event.title: 78.1% of its vote to George W. Bush in 2004

data.event: Montgomery County is one of the most heavily Republican counties in Texas, giving 78.1% of its vote to George W. Bush in 2004 and 75.8% of its vote to John McCain in 2008.

event.title: 75.8% of its vote to John McCain in 2008

data.event: Montgomery County is one of the most heavily Republican counties in Texas, giving 78.1% of its vote to George W. Bush in 2004 and 75.8% of its vote to John McCain in 2008.
The county has not been won by a Democratic presidential candidate since native Texan Lyndon Johnson won 60.9% of the county's vote in 1964.
